page.title: 10GOVERNMENT ACTION
page.content: Following a preliminary survey of matters of social and political concern we took 15 ideas and asked our parents to choose which of the 15 they thought most urgently required Government action.130 responded and 30%,the most popular choice,thought that job creation was the most important task facing Government today.Next was give more help to poor countries and make stricter laws to control drugs.More than 10% chose banning nuclear weapons, improving education and making immigration easier.Matters of less importance included improving old age pensions,Social Security payments, housing for the poor,and stricter laws to control crime.We wonder if and how this list may change from year to year and century to century.
